result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Dasko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michael J Dasko in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Cts. 1 and 2. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
-  9 months jail - credit for 236 days  - consecutive to Ct. 2 and 15CF140
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision in file 15CF140
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision in file 15CF140

Ct. 2:
-  9 months jail consecutive to Ct. 1 and 15CF140
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision in file 15CF140
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision in file 15CF140

Defendant Michael J Dasko in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer S. Palnovsek from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Detective J. Italiano from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Defense counsel presents bail motion arguments. State objects to any modification. Court denied the motion, but does change 1 condition.  Arraignment scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.
